item.title: Overflowing bin, 28th January
item.description:
This is an almost daily problem outside 64 Norwood road/junction with Deronda road. There are 4 flats in the block but only one green recycling bin which is filled with rubbish and overflowing onto the pavement. The foxes then spread the waste along Deronda road. Multiple reports made about this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deronda Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bad cracks and potholes on the road., 28th January
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a hazardous pothole located in the middle of the roadway. The condition of the road has deteriorated significantly and continues to worsen over time. This is the second time I have complained about this. The pothole poses a serious safety risk to motorists, as it is difficult to avoid and has the potential to cause damage to vehicles, including tyres, suspension, and undercarriage components. With ongoing traffic and adverse weather, the situation is likely to escalate further if not addressed promptly. Given the risk to public safety and property, I respectfully request that this issue be inspected and repaired as a matter of urgency. Timely maintenance would help prevent accidents, vehicle damage, and further degradation of the road surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Kevington Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
